titleStmt.title: Thomas Murnear et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10745

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To his Excelency Beriah Magoffin Esqr
Govrnor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Whereas Abijah Burns a citizen of owsley (Co) was indicted for carrying Consealed deadly weapons. and at the May term of the owsley Circuit Court 1861 was tried and fined $50.. your petitioners would respectfully State that he is a very poor honest hard working man and very quiet peaceable man and owing to the great secarcety of money we believe that if the Collection of sd fine was pressed he would be forced to go to prison
therefore we your petitioners would respectfully ask your Excelincy to remit so much of sd fine as is in your power to remit beleiving it is a case worthy of Executive Clemency

Thos Murnear
A B Gilbert
R C Minter
O R Mayor
Joseph P Slomes
Wm A Rornald
Jesse Thomas
Joel Flanery
Eli Boling
Rob R Johnson
U P. Hampton
Charles G Cole
